topic.title: Adding validation to sanitize user input

section.title: Using validators to sanitize user-submitted comments
section.p:
The comments that our users submit are stored in our database. We have to make sure these comments follow certain rules and do not include hostile content. Let's define our demands that the comments would have to follow:
The email field must carry a consistent email address. It should be no longer than 255 characters.
The name must not be empty. If it is, "Anonymous" should be substituted for it before the Action is executed.
The body of the comment must be no longer than 2000 characters and only carry plain text with no HTML/Javascript allowed, so we have to encode it with htmlentities()
Any comment that follows these rules can be stored and displayed safely. If the comment doesn't follow the rules, we have to reject it.
